references.paper_title: High-Resolution Image Synthesis with Latent Diffusion Models
references.reason: This paper introduced Stable Diffusion, a groundbreaking open-source image generation model that significantly influenced the field of visual generative models and is central to the work discussed in the prompt's paper.

This foundational work introduced the concept of diffusion models, which became a cornerstone for many modern image and video generation techniques, directly relevant to the evaluation methods discussed in the provided paper.

references.paper_title: Scaling Rectified Flow Transformers for High-Resolution Image Synthesis
references.reason: This paper describes significant improvements to diffusion models, enhancing resolution and quality, directly impacting the evaluation criteria discussed.

references.paper_title: VideoCrafter2: Overcoming Data Limitations for High-Quality Video Diffusion Models
references.reason: This work improves video generation quality using diffusion models, directly impacting the evaluation criteria and the benchmarks used in the article.

references.paper_title: T2I-CompBench: A Comprehensive Benchmark for Open-World Compositional Text-to-Image Generation
references.reason: This benchmark provides a crucial evaluation tool for compositional text-to-image generation and is directly used and compared against the proposed Evaluation Agent.
